name: cottonseed to generic market for energy feed | energy feed, gross | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20013/documentation

This is a linking (transfering) activity which links cottonseed, to the generic market for energy feed. Cottonseeds are a by-product of the cotton ginning process which produces cotton fibres.

The activity starts with the reception of cottonseeds.

The activity models the part of cottonseeds that contribute to the generic market for energy feed, resulting in energy and protein outputs.
category: C:Manufacturing/10:Manufacture of food products/108:Manufacture of prepared animal feeds/1080:Manufacture of prepared animal feeds

exchanges.description: Calculated based on literature value for "cottonseed" (Feedipedia, 2019), which reports a crude protein content of 21.3% of dry matter; while gross energy content equates to 23.8 MJ/kg dry matter of feed. Dry matter content equates 92.3% of wet mass of feed. Reference(s): Feedipedia (2019) Hominy Feed, Animal Feed Resources Information System, Accessed online at: https://www.feedipedia.org/node/742 on 05/06/2019.
